root.name: int()

example.code:
# Convert floating point number f = 65.8 i = int(f) print(f) # Prints 65
# Convert from string s = "1234" i = int(s) print(i) # Prints 1234
# Convert from string with base s = "1234" i = int(s, 16) # base 16 (hexidecimal) print(i) # Prints "4660"

root.description: Converts a non-integer type (such as a floating-point number or string) to its integer representation.

parameter.label: value
parameter.description: the value to convert to an integer

parameter.label: base
parameter.description: if value is a string, the base to perform the conversion in
